definition: Heaven never bars one's way (idiom); don't despair and you will find a way through./Never give up hope./Never say die.
pinyin: tian1 wu2 jue2 ren2 zhi1 lu4

definition: to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means

sentences.english: Days were absolutely no way is the way out of the step-by-step.
sentences.chinese: 天無絕人之路，路是一步一步走出來的。

definition: the last of the three entry-level exams in the imperial examination system of Ming and Qing dynasties
lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
unable to sit or stand still (out of nervousness etc) (idiom)
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
vehicle/(more specifically) mobility vehicle (mobility scooter, electric wheelchair, Segway etc)
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
an express train sets off/fig. to work in haste/to rush
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
